> Yes.  What if it's an irregular polygon for instance?  Perhaps even a 
> concave polygon?


I doubt that radiance has something like that, afaik those polygons are 
"flattened".


> Seems like it would be handy to have a way of getting what Radiance 
> knows about the illumination of a specified polygon and outputting it 
> directly?


Would still be nice because this could be used in a number of ways... 
e.g. output of prerendered polygons to vrml, opengl, ... ?


CU Lars.
